item.text: Now the Philistines were fighting against Israel. The men of Israel fled from the Philistines and many of them fell dead on Mount Gilboa.

The <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st> <st data-num="01692" class="">stayed right on the heels</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>. <st data-num="06430" class="">They</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05221" class="">struck down</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st>, <st data-num="041" class="">Abinadab</st>, and <st data-num="04444" class="">Malki-Shua</st>.
Saul himself was in the thick of the battle; the archers spotted him and wounded him severely.

Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and stab me with it! Otherwise these uncircumcised people will come, stab me, and torture me.” But his armor-bearer refused to do it, because he was very afraid. So Saul took his sword and fell on it.

When his <st data-num="03627" class="">armor</st>-<st data-num="05375" class="">bearer</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="04191">was dead</st>, <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="05307" class="">fell</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his own <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st> and <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> him.
So Saul, his three sons, his armor-bearer, and all his men died together that day.

When the men of Israel who were in the valley and across the Jordan saw that the men of Israel had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned the cities and fled. The Philistines came and occupied them.
The next day, when the Philistines came to strip loot from the corpses, they discovered Saul and his three sons lying dead on Mount Gilboa.

They <st data-num="03772" class="">cut off</st> Saul’s<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> and <st data-num="06584" class="">stripped</st> him <st data-num="06584" class="">of</st> his <st data-num="03627" class="">armor</st>. They <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> messengers to <st data-num="01319" class="">announce the news</st> in the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> of their <st data-num="06091" class="">idols</st> and among their <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> throughout the <st data-num="05439" class="">surrounding</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st>.
They placed Saul’s armor in the temple of the Ashtoreths and hung his corpse on the city wall of Beth Shan.
When the residents of Jabesh Gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,

<st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="0376 02428">warriors</st> <st data-num="06965" class="">set out</st> and <st data-num="01980" class="">traveled</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">throughout</st> the <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st>. They <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul’s</st> <st data-num="01472" class="">corpse</st> and the <st data-num="01472" class="">corpses</st> of his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> from the city <st data-num="02346" class="">wall</st> of <st data-num="01052" class="">Beth Shan</st> and <st data-num="0935" class="">went</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="03003" class="">Jabesh</st>, <st data-num="08033" class="">where</st> they <st data-num="08313" class="">burned</st> them.
They took the bones and buried them under the tamarisk tree at Jabesh; then they fasted for seven days.
